long_title: Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation With 3-days Busulfan Plus Fludarabine as Conditioning in Patients With Relapsed or Refractory T-, NK/T-cell Lymphomas
prior_treatment_requirements: Inclusion Criteria:
2. Histologically confirmed T or NK cell lymphomas :
* anaplastic large cell lymphoma
* angioimmunoblastic T-cell lymphoma,
* peripheral T-cell lymphoma, NOS
* NK/T-cell lymphoma
3. Relapsed after or refractory to one or more of previous chemotherapy including frontline autologous HSCT.
4. At least one measured lesion using conventional CT or PET CT at the time of relapse after or refractory to one or more of previous chemotherapy and before salvage chemotherapy
5. Complete or Partial response after short cycles of salvage chemotherapy

6. Patients who have HLA full-match (8/8 in HLA-A, B, C, DR by DNA high-resolution technique) or one-locus mismatch (7/8) sibling, or unrelated bone marrow or peripheral blood or cord blood stem cell donors
7. ECOG performance status ≤ 2
8. Charlson Comorbidity Index (CCI) before HSCT ≤ 3
9. Adequate renal function : serum creatinine level \< 2.0 mg/dL
10. Adequate liver function :
* Transaminase (AST/ALT) \< 3 X upper normal value (or \< 5 x ULN in the presence of lymphoma involvement of the liver)
* Total bilirubin \< 2 X upper normal value (or \< 5 x ULN in the presence of NK/T involvement of the liver)
11. Cardiac ejection fraction ≥ 50 % as measured by MUGA or 2D ECHO without clinically significant abnormality
12. No clinically significant infection
13. No clinically significant bleeding symptoms or sign
14. Patients who decided to participate in this study and signed for a written consent
Exclude - Exclusion Criteria:
Exclude - 1. Adult T cell leukemia/lymphoma, Lymphoblastic lymphoma, Primary cutaneous CD30+ T cell disorders Mycosis fungoides, Sezary SD
Exclude - 2. Patients who have previously performed Allo-HSCT
Exclude - 3. T cell lymphoma with primary central nervous system (CNS) Involvement.
Exclude - \*\* However, patients who have only had prophylactic intrathecal or intravenous chemotherapy against CNS disease are eligible.
Exclude - 4. Patients with a known history of HIV seropositivity or HCV (+).
Exclude - \*\* Patients with HBV are eligible. However, primary prophylaxis using antiviral agents is recommended for HBV carrier or prevent HBV reactivation during whole treatment period.
Exclude - 5. Any other malignancies within the past 5 years
Exclude - \*\* Except curatively treated non-melanoma skin cancer or in situ carcinoma of cervix uteri
Exclude - 6. Ejection fraction \< 50% by a echocardiography
Exclude - 7. FEV1 \<60% or DLCO \<60% by a pulmonary function test
Exclude - 8. ECOG performance status 3 or 4
Exclude - 9. Combined serious medical problem or disease
Exclude - * Serious or unstable heart disease although proper treatment
Exclude - * Myocardial infarction in recent 3 months
Exclude - * Underlying serious neurologic or psychiatric disease including dementia or seizure
Exclude - * Active uncontrolled infection including hepatitis B and C
Exclude - * Serious other medical problems observed by the doctors in charge of the patient
Exclude - 10. Pregnant or lactating women, women of childbearing potential not employing adequate contraception
short_title: Allogeneic Stem Cell Transplantation in Relapsed/Refractory T-, NK/T-cell Lymphomas
summary: Relapsed and refractory T-cell lymphomas have been reported to have dismal outcomes. The role of allogeneic stem cell transplantation have been demonstrated in these patients. This clinical trial is studying the efficacy and safety of busulfan plus fludarabine as conditioning therapy followed by allogeneic stem cell transplantation (Allo-SCT) in T- and NK/T-cell lymphoma patients who have relapsed or are refractory to previous chemotherapies including autologous transplantation.

arm.arm_description: Conditioning chemotherapy: Fludarabine and Busulfan followed by Allogeneic stem cell transplantation
